episodes.title: Catching Up After a Break; Honda CRV Engine Failures, and Can you prevent Being Exploited?
episodes.description: After a month away from the show we discuss the power of taking a break, exploitation and how the Engine Failures with Honda illuminate how shady car dealerships can be

episodes.title: Why the Landmark Forum is NOT a cult-- Cult Expert Rick Ross
episodes.description: Our guest is a longtime critic of Landmark Worldwide and features them in his book about cults and cult-like organizations "Cults Inside Out: How People Get in and Can Get Out". Volunteers and Staff were trained how to speak about him and his website in Landmark's Corp Q & A. We will discuss all of this and ask questions from aspects of his book.

episodes.title: Landmark Worldwide Files Bankruptcy and Press Release: We Have Questions
episodes.description: Landmark released an announcement which included announcing filing for bankruptcy.

episodes.title: What Does Dopamine Have to Do with Transformation?  with Dr. John Hunter
episodes.description: The Landmark Forum has been categorized by experts as a "Large Group Awareness Training" ("LGAT)". In this discussion we compare notes with Dr. John Hunter on his work on LGAT's and our experiences at Landmark Worldwide. One of the questions we will be asking How does dopamine play into our experience of transformation?

episodes.title: Erik Rojas Talks About Being a New Staff Member for Landmark Worldwide
episodes.description: Erik Rojas participated in The Landmark Forum when he was a teenager. He quickly moved through Landmark programs until he eventually ended on Landmark Staff. He talks about some of the abuse he went through working for Landmark Worldwide.

episodes.title: Anne & Erik: What Have We Learned So Far? Where do we go from Here?
episodes.description: Healing, Exploitation, Abuse, Seeking Safely. Anne guest hosts with Erik as they evaluate the conversation that has been happening since March 2024 when she released the book. .

episodes.title: Queer Life or Compliance to Landmark Forum... Choose with Mark C. Tafoya
episodes.description: How does taking the Landmark Forum, a three day self help empowerment seminar turn into relinquishing your own identity?  Our guest, a former Landmark Worldwide Seminar Leader, shares their story of compliance/non-compliance- control/independence and how "they really have no means of dealing with how different our queer lives are."

episodes.title: Author Anne L. Peterson: the Line Between Transformation & Exploitation
episodes.description: The author of the book "Is this a Cult?" that ignited this whole conversation about the Landmark Forum, Landmark, and Werner Erhard joins us to discuss what has happened since releasing the book and to discuss the topic of exploitation.

episodes.title: Landmark Worldwide Needs to Apologize to its Black Leadership with Jennifer Clarke
episodes.description:
Our guest in our next YouTube video/podcast is former SELP Leader and Staff Member Jennifer Clarke. In her words, this is her "Love letter to the Landmark graduates."

This is an important conversation as Jennifer shares her views and what the final straw was for her with Landmark after being a leader and advocate for decades.

This conversation is distinct from our previous ones, it is eye-opening and essential to our message of calling for change and accountability.

We applaud Jennifer.

episodes.title: Letting Go of Landmark and (Re)Learning Who You Are
episodes.description:
In this conversation, our guest shares about deconstructing and letting go of Landmark. We will examine the Landmark Worldwide and Landmark Forum experience, and inquire about the tools obtained. Are they needed to live a successful and self-expressed life? 

Our guest's story also highlights what it could like to relearn who you are after leaving the Landmark ecosystem.

episodes.title: I was a "HARD NO" to doing the Landmark Forum for a year....
episodes.description:
Tonight, we speak with a recent Seminar Leader participant who's family got swept up in Landmark Worldwide and recently left the organization- trying to make sense of what just happened. 

This conversation opens up questions about trusting your own gut, social pressure, and should people be coached to be unreasonable at the cost of their family and relationships?

episodes.title: What is "Love Bombing?" Does it happen at Landmark or The Landmark Forum?"
episodes.description:
New live streams most Tuesdays at 8p.m. central, 6p.m. pacific.
This week we explore falling in love with Landmark Worldwide and then it all falling apart on you. Does this fit in the concept of "Love Bombing?"

episodes.title: Top 5 Changes Landmark Worldwide Needs to make
episodes.description: Landmark has the ability to change its organization and the reports of verbal abuse, exploitation, hypocrisy and misinformation. Tonight we invite Landmark to "get off it" and end practices that have impacted people so many people's lives.

episodes.title: Former Landmark Worldwide Staff Member Opens Up About Devastating Experience
episodes.description: A former staff member approach me to tell their story about the corporate culture of Landmark Worldwide (also know as Landmark Education) and the Landmark Forum.
